title: Markets Await Decision on Brexit Extension
text:
PSG Wealth Daily Investment Update, 25 October 2019

The JSE fell on Thursday, while global markets waited for the EU’s decision amid speculation that the it may give its verdict on a Brexit extension by Friday. The JSE All Share fell 0.17%.US stocks opened higher on Thursday, as solid results from Microsoft (NASDAQ: ), Lam Research (NASDAQ: ) and Tesla lifted sentiment. However, at 20h30 the traded 0.18% lower.With no fireworks from European Central Bank (ECB) chief Mario Draghi's last policy meeting on Thursday, encouraging results from German heavyweights and British drugmaker AstraZeneca drove European stocks to their strongest close since January 2018. Just after the JSE closed, the had added 0.81%, France’s 0.33%, and Germany’s 0.54%.Hong Kong stocks closed higher on Thursday, on hopes of more stimulus to support the island city’s faltering growth amid political unrest. The rose 0.87% at close of trade.Japan’s rose on Thursday, as investors bought back recently beaten down semiconductor-related shares on optimism for improved corporate earnings. The Nikkei ended up by 0.55%.The rand was firmer on Thursday after the ECB kept the refinancing rate steady at 0%, the last announcement for Draghi, who will be replaced as ECB chief by former IMF chief, Christine Lagarde on 1 November. At 20h30, a dollar traded at $14.67.Gold prices barely moved on Thursday as investors waited for fresh developments on the Sino-US trade front, and clarity on Brexit, after the EU delayed a decision on granting Britain an extension.Oil slipped below $61 a barrel on Thursday as concern over the demand outlook offset a surprise drop in US crude inventories and the prospect of further action by Opec and its allies to support the market.
